thread.title: Labrador's Curtis Barrett gets standing ovation for protecting Parliament Hill during 2014 shooting
thread.title_full: Labrador's Curtis Barrett gets standing ovation for protecting Parliament Hill during 2014 shooting

author: cbc
title: Labrador's Curtis Barrett gets standing ovation for protecting Parliament Hill during 2014 shooting
text:
Members of Parliament took to their feet Friday to applaud a Labrador man who helped protect them during a 2014 shooting.
RCMP Cpl. Curtis Barrett, who hails from Labrador City, was praised in a speech by Labrador MP Yvonne Jones as being one of the "men and women on the front lines," defending democratic institutions and communities.
She thanked him for his "courage, skills and actions to protect in a time of crisis."
Honouring Cpl.Curtis Barrett 4 his Act of Bravery-Parliament Hill in 2014 @RalphGoodale @OldfordKaren @CanadianPM @VOCMOpenline @NTVNewsNL pic.twitter.com/dNOXfYcJPe
â€” @YvonneJJones Barrett played a key role, Jones said, in stopping a shooter who killed Cpl. Nathan Cirillo at the National War Memorial on Oct. 22, 2014.
Ottawa shooting: A day of chaos leaves soldier, gunman dead The gunman was later shot dead inside the Centre Block of Parliament.
Barrett was awarded the Governor General's Star of Courage in October 2016 and will be honoured by his hometown in March.
2 Labradorians honoured for bravery and courage by Governor General Barrett was one of the police officers who charged down the Hall of Honour in a tactical formation, and according to the 2016 award citation he "walked directly toward the gunman while also firing his weapon."
